page.title: 20ROUNDUP & CREDITS, ST.ALLEN
page.content: It has been a pleasure to visit farms & homes in St.Allen area, & to hear Cornish farmers talk with enthusiasm about their land.They are hard-working positively forward-looking, determined to make full use of modern technology & to continue to make a living for themselves & their children. They are concerned for the well-being of their animals,keen to keep high standards in maintenance of land,hedges,&buildings. They appreciate good quality of farm life & variety of jobs with changing seasons through the year. They foresee a tougher future when only efficient farmers will survive. No-one seemed to know of the Domesday Project, but all were interested & very helpful. SUSAN PETTIT,housewife,mother.MICHAEL, 18mths.joined in Domesday expeditions. BARRY,G.P.in Truro wrote RuralMedicine LIZ,JONATHAN,JOANNA helped &supported.
